result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendra Pauline Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kendra Pauline Pierce is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kendra Pauline Pierce was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today November 20, 2015.

 In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file, balance to be paid today.

-Defendant to participate in Victim Impact Panel.
-Maintain mental health treatment, take medications and keep all appointments as scheduled.
-Participate in any additional programming as recommended by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Defendant to maintain employment or education.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-Apology letter has already been submitted to the Court.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson DF:  Kendra Pauline Pierce appeared. Case called at 8:18. ADA Hartung updates the Court. Atty. Harrelson agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 15CM273. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CM273. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and 3 in 15CM273. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence I/S  90 days St. Croix County Jail 
1 year probation with conditions:
- 30 days condition time STAYED
- DE to participate in a victim impact panel
- Maintain mental health treatment, take medications and keeping all appointments as scheduled. 
- Participate in any additional programming recommended by agent. 
- 20 hours of community service. 
- Costs including costs of supervision
  Apply money on file.
- $199.51 restitution
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- DE to maintain  employment or education. 


DE will pay the remainder today. 
DE to sign up for probation today. 
Apology letter (has been submitted to the Court)

Per TCH 5/28/15 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Pre-trial conference on July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Wal-Mart in New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
